question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable for demonstration. Develop a video transition effects editor where users can upload two video clips and choose from three common transition effects (such as cross-fade, push-pull transition, flip transition) to merge them into a complete video.

checklist.title: Is the video upload and management system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code provides a complete solution for uploading, validating, and managing two video clips. Check for proper file validation (format checking, size limits), progress indicators during upload, and appropriate error handling. Score 0 if video upload functionality is missing, 5 if basic upload exists but lacks validation or error handling, and 10 if comprehensive upload management with proper feedback is implemented.

checklist.title: Are the three transition effects (cross-fade, push-pull, flip) properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate the quality and completeness of the transition effects implementation. Each effect should have customizable parameters (duration, direction if applicable) and accurate preview capability. Deduct 3 points for each missing effect. Deduct 2 points if an effect lacks parameter customization. Give full 10 points only if all three effects are implemented with proper customization options and accurate rendering.

checklist.title: Does the editor provide real-time preview functionality?
checklist.description: Check if users can see a real-time or near-real-time preview of the transition effect before rendering the final video. The preview should accurately represent the final output, showing the actual transition at the correct timing. Deduct 5 points if preview is significantly delayed or inaccurate. Deduct 10 points if no preview functionality exists. Full score requires smooth, accurate preview with minimal latency.

checklist.title: Is the video rendering and export process complete?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the application can render the final video with the selected transition and provide download options in appropriate formats (MP4, WebM). Check for progress indicators during rendering, estimated time remaining, and ability to cancel the process. Deduct 5 points if rendering lacks progress feedback, 5 points if export options are limited, and 10 points if the rendering process is not implemented at all.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as unsupported video formats, interrupted uploads, browser compatibility issues, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Additional transition effects beyond the required three 2. Audio crossfading during transitions 3. Custom keyframe support for transitions 4. Thumbnails timeline for easy navigation). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple video processing libraries doing the same job) 2. Function modules unrelated to video editing (e.g., a built-in social media platform) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations in the UI). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating video processing/UI/state management layers), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast sliding, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
